djangotailoring.tracking¶

  • djangotailoring.tracking.models
    • Models
    • Events and Logging
  • djangotailoring.tracking.eventnames

  • djangotailoring.tracking.support

    • View Mixins

The tracking application is dedicated to supporting the creation and management of Events, and their associated objects. Events are records that fundimentally include names and timestamps. Apps are free to create events with any name, and use them for whatever features they wish. Events can also have a free-text note, as well as a GenericForeignKey relation to any other Django-managed object.

Functions¶

djangotailoring.tracking.create_event(name, request=None, user=None, note=None, related_object=None)¶
Parameters:
  • name (a string) – the event name
  • request (a Django HttpRequest object) – the request in whose context this event is created
  • user (a django.contrib.auth User) – the user for which this event is associated
  • note (a string) – a free-form note for this event
  • related_object (a Django Model instance) – an associated model object for this event
Return type:

a djangotailoring.tracking.models.Event instance
Returns:

a persisted Event with the given parameters.

A convenience function for the creation of events, especially when created in the context of an HttpRequest.

Make an Event record for a given set of parameters. If request is given, the user is pulled from the request, and in the absense of a note, the note is set to the request path.

Auto-created Events¶

While most Events are created explicitly by your code, there are a few events that are automatically created when this application is installed.

Login/Logout¶

Events are written whenever a user logs in or out of the current site. The events are:

  • djangotailoring.tracking.EventNames.UserLoggedIn
  • djangotailoring.tracking.EventNames.UserLoggedOut
